definitions.definition: a piece of cloth, usually rectangular and attached to a pole at one edge, that has a pattern that shows it represents a country or a group, or has a particular meaning:
examples: Flags of all the participating countries are flying outside the stadium.

definitions.definition: to put a mark on something so it can be found easily among other similar things:
examples: Flag any files that might be useful later.

definitions.definition: to mark computer information with one of two possible values so that you can deal with it later:
examples: We'll flag the records of interest in the database and then we can give you a print-out.
